intro: Euphrasia setulosa, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Euphrasia setulosa is often found in temperate regions and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
